abstract: Art critics, collectors and curators oppose decision by Mexico City's Museo Jumex to cancel controversial exhibition by Hermann Nitsch, saying cancellation has damaged museum's credibility; show would have included works like The Last Supper, canvases splattered with blood and black paint, along with videos of art performances involving animal viscera.
lead_paragraph: In abandoning a controversial exhibition, this institution in Mexico City may have hurt its credibility in the art world.

headline.main: Museo Jumex Cancels a Hermann Nitsch Show
headline.print_headline: Blood in the Street, Not on the Walls

snippet: In abandoning a controversial exhibition, this institution in Mexico City may have hurt its credibility in the art world.
